intro: Thesium maximiliani, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are small, white or pink, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Thesium maximiliani is characterized by its succulent leaves and is often found in high-altitude environments.
